DataElement.preferredDefinition: The term that describes a strategy to minimize bias where the intervention assignment may or may not be revealed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information that describes an experiment or clinical trial in which patients/participants and their healthcare providers may or may not know which agent or intervention is being assigned.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: Describes an experiment or clinical trial in which patients (single-blinded) or the patients and their doctors (double-blinded) do not know which drug or treatment is being given.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic of experiment design in which one or more groups involved (receiving, administering, or evaluating intervention) are unaware of which intervention any particular subject is receiving.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The term that specifies an assignment designation for minimizing bias in a clinical study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
A study in which the subject, the investigator, or anyone assessing the outcome is aware of the assignment
in at least one treatment group but unaware of the treatment assignment(s) in one or more other treatment groups.

Concepts.definition: A study in which the subject, the investigator, or anyone assessing the outcome is aware of the assignment in at least one treatment group but unaware of the treatment assignment(s) in one or more other treatment groups.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of clinical trial in which only the doctor knows whether a patient is taking the standard treatment or the new treatment being tested.  This helps prevent bias in treatment studies.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that stipulates the subject to be unaware of the drug or treatment assignment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of studying a drug or procedure in which both the subjects and investigators are kept unaware of who is actually getting which specific treatment. (MSH2001)

Concepts.definition: A study method in which neither the subjects nor the investigators are permitted to know which subject is receiving which treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes an experiment or clinical trial in which patients (single-blinded) or the patients and their doctors (double-blinded) do not know which drug or treatment is being given.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic of experiment design in which one or more groups involved (receiving, administering, or evaluating intervention) are unaware of which intervention any particular subject is receiving.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of study that stipulates both the health provider and the subject be aware of the drug or treatment assignment.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that stipulates both the health provider and the subject be aware of the drug or treatment assignment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
A study in which knowledge of the treatment assignments are concealed from the people who organize and
analyze the data of a study as well as from subjects and investigators.

Concepts.definition: A study in which knowledge of the treatment assignments are concealed from the people who organize and analyze the data of a study as well as from subjects and investigators.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Describes an experiment or clinical trial in which patients (single-blinded) or the patients and their doctors (double-blinded) do not know which drug or treatment is being given.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic of experiment design in which one or more groups involved (receiving, administering, or evaluating intervention) are unaware of which intervention any particular subject is receiving.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
